Incident.Summary: Two Subjects arrived in a rental vehicle, and attempted to commit fraud in Frederick County, Maryland.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Case Number: 23-MSP-026651
Date: 07/27/2023
Time: 1400 hours
Location: Safeway located at, 151 Walkers Village Way, Walkersville, Maryland 21793.

Video/ Audio Recordings:

- CAR- B-68 // Body worn Camera is available // In Car Camera is not available for this incident.
- Assisting- No assisting troopers.

 ATTACHMENTS:
  • One photograph of the brand of re-loadable Prepaid Card.
  • Photographs of both suspects.
  • MVA Printout of suspect vehicle. 
 VICTIM / COMPLAINANT:
  • Safeway, located at, 151 Walkers Village Way, Walkersville, MD 21793.
 
 WITNESS / NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK:
 Witness #1 and #2
  • Rhonda Trail (DOB: 05/14/1956) ** Safeway manager. **
  • Shylvine (Cashier)

**** Conducted a review of the stores surveillance cameras ****

 Suspects
  • Unknown #1 male (Dark clothing) Black Nike sweatshirt / black Nike Shorts and shoes. Dreads
  • Unknown #1 male (Dark clothing) Black t-shirt, pants, socks, and white sandals. Short afro.  
   NARRATIVE:

        On 07/27/2023 at approximately 14:00 hours, I, TFC Devin #7046 of the Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack was advised of a suspicious activity at Safeway, located at, 151 Walkers Village Way, Walkersville, MD 21793.  

      The complainant advised that he was sitting inside his vehicle talking on the phone in the parking lot of the Walkersville Safeway. At approximately 1400 hours, a silver Chevrolet Impala, bearing Kentucky registration (C7Y017), parked in the Safeway lot. Two number 1 males were in the vehicle with dark clothing. The driver, exited the vehicle, and entered the Safeway. After a few minutes, the driver exited the store without merchandise, and moved the vehicle to a different parking spot. The passenger then repeated the same actions of the driver. Due to the described events, and the behavior matching past fraud cases at this location, I responded to investigate.

    I located the vehicle, and observed one occupant in the vehicle. I conducted an MVA check of the registration, which returned to the vehicle. The vehicle returned as an Enterprise rental, and it was valid. The occupant inside the vehicle, observed my patrol vehicle, and immediately got on phone. A few seconds later, a number 1 male quickly exited the store, entered the Impala, and the described vehicle quickly left. I did not attempt to follow or stop the vehicle. The male that I observed exit the store was wearing a black Nike sweatshirt, shorts, and shoes. The male had long dreadlocks, and was approximately 6 feet tall / 205 pounds.

        I conducted a patrol check of the area, and then entered the Safeway. I approached the manager, and asked if anyone attempted to purchase prepaid cards?  The manager advised, “Yes, just now”. The two males that I observed in the silver Chevrolet Impala were then described by the employees. The manager was identified as, Rhonda Trail, 2/F, (DOB: 05/14/1956), who was identified by name and date of birth.

     Trail explained that approximately 14:00 hours, two black males entered the store, individually. Both males entered checkout line number 1, where Shylvine was the cashier. Shylvine was just hired by the Safeway three days prior. The males handed Shylvine, “Cavaliers Prepaid Cards”, and requested each card to be activated with $400.00 of US Currency. Shylvine activated the cards, and the males attempted to divert her attention several times. The card that both males used in attempt to purchase the prepaid cards were declined. Shylvine asked to see the card, and the suspect held his thumb over the name of the card. Shylvine did not hand him the activated cards, and the suspect left the store. Then another black male entered, and attempted the same described events, and was unsuccessful. This male was described to be approximately 5’05’’ in height / 150 pounds, short black afro, black Nike shirt, and pants. This suspect was also wearing, white sandals with black socks.

       
 The Safeway and the surrounding businesses, do not have exterior cameras, but I recorded the registration during the attempted crime. This report was completed for law enforcement information only. I will be reporting this incident to WMIC, to possibly link other successful thefts that these suspects may have committed in the area. The registration of the rental vehicle could be used to later identify the unknown males. I have photographs of the males attached to this report.       
              
     CHARGES: No charges

     All the above events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland.

     Case Status: I request that this case be closed, law enforcement information only.
